snippet: In most advanced countries, gun homicides are as rare as deaths from falling tree limbs or plane crashes.
abstract: The Upshot; United States leads world in gun deaths; statistics show that roughly 27 people are shot dead every day of year in US, including losses from mass shootings, like that in Orlando, Fla, nightclub.

byline.original: By KEVIN QUEALY and MARGOT SANGER-KATZ

lead_paragraph: In most advanced countries, gun homicides are as rare as deaths from falling tree limbs or plane crashes.

headline.print_headline: The U.S. Is a World Apart in Gun Death Rates
headline.main: Compare These Gun Death Rates: The U.S. Is in a Different World
